explanation: To determine whether OS_Unlock_Global violates the MISRA rule against direct or indirect recursion you must examine any functions it calls. OS_Unlock_Global calls only OS_Unlock_Global_Impl, so that implementation must be inspected to see if it (directly or indirectly) calls OS_Unlock_Global (or any other function chain that returns to OS_Unlock_Global). If OS_Unlock_Global_Impl calls additional functions, those would also need to be included — but based on the provided static call graph OS_Unlock_Global_Impl has no callees, making it the only required additional symbol to check for indirect recursion.
